ci_support_linux_64_r_base4.4.yaml:
cdt_name:
- conda
channel_sources:
- conda-forge
channel_targets:
- conda-forge main
cran_mirror:
- https://cran.r-project.org
docker_image:
- quay.io/condaforge/linux-anvil-x86_64:alma9
pin_run_as_build:
  r-base:
    min_pin: x.x
    max_pin: x.x
r_base:
- '4.4'
target_platform:
- linux-64

about.summary: The goal of this package is to cover the most common steps in probability of default (PD) rating model development and validation. The main procedures available are those that refer to univariate, bivariate, multivariate analysis, calibration and validation. Along with accompanied 'monobin' and 'monobinShiny' packages, 'PDtoolkit' provides functions which are suitable for different data transformation and modeling tasks such as: imputations, monotonic binning of numeric risk factors, binning of categorical risk factors, weights of evidence (WoE) and information value (IV) calculations, WoE coding (replacement of risk factors modalities with WoE values), risk factor clustering, area under curve (AUC) calculation and others. Additionally, package provides set of validation functions for testing homogeneity, heterogeneity, discriminatory and predictive power of the model.

The goal of this package is to cover the most common steps in probability of default (PD) rating model development and validation. The main procedures available are those that refer to univariate, bivariate, multivariate analysis, calibration and validation. Along with accompanied 'monobin' and 'monobinShiny' packages, 'PDtoolkit' provides functions which are suitable for different data transformation and modeling tasks such as: imputations, monotonic binning of numeric risk factors, binning of categorical risk factors, weights of evidence (WoE) and information value (IV) calculations, WoE coding (replacement of risk factors modalities with WoE values), risk factor clustering, area under curve (AUC) calculation and others. Additionally, package provides set of validation functions for testing homogeneity, heterogeneity, discriminatory and predictive power of the model.

name: r-pdtoolkit
raw_meta_yaml:
{% set version = '1.2.0' %}
{% set posix = 'm2-' if win else '' %}

package:
  name: r-pdtoolkit
  version: {{ version|replace("-", "_") }}

source:
  url:
    - {{ cran_mirror }}/src/contrib/PDtoolkit_{{ version }}.tar.gz
    - {{ cran_mirror }}/src/contrib/Archive/PDtoolkit/PDtoolkit_{{ version }}.tar.gz
  sha256: 7354bc80a298eecaeac2cda824d7825447b1cc914429d8129e48840ab82b9a3c

build:
  number: 1
  noarch: generic
  rpaths:
    - lib/R/lib/
    - lib/
  missing_dso_whitelist:
    - '*/R.dll'        # [win]
    - '*/Rblas.dll'    # [win]
    - '*/Rlapack.dll'  # [win]

requirements:
  build:
    - {{ posix }}zip               # [win]
    - cross-r-base {{ r_base }}    # [build_platform != target_platform]
  host:
    - r-base
    - r-dplyr
    - r-monobin
    - r-rpart
  run:
    - r-base
    - r-dplyr
    - r-monobin
    - r-rpart

test:
  commands:
    - $R -e "library('PDtoolkit')"           # [not win]
    - "\"%R%\" -e \"library('PDtoolkit')\""  # [win]

about:
  home: https://github.com/andrija-djurovic/PDtoolkit
  license: GPL-3.0-or-later
  summary: 'The goal of this package is to cover the most common steps in probability of default
    (PD) rating model development and validation. The main procedures available are
    those that refer to univariate, bivariate, multivariate analysis, calibration and
    validation. Along with accompanied ''monobin'' and ''monobinShiny'' packages, ''PDtoolkit''
    provides functions which are suitable for different data transformation and modeling
    tasks such as: imputations, monotonic binning of numeric risk factors, binning of
    categorical risk factors, weights of evidence (WoE) and information value (IV) calculations,
    WoE coding (replacement of risk factors modalities with WoE values), risk factor
    clustering, area under curve (AUC) calculation and others. Additionally, package
    provides set of validation functions for testing homogeneity, heterogeneity, discriminatory
    and predictive power of the model.'
  license_family: GPL3
  license_file:
    - '{{ environ["PREFIX"] }}/lib/R/share/licenses/GPL-3'

extra:
  recipe-maintainers:
    - conda-forge/r
    - okankcb

# Package: PDtoolkit
# Title: Collection of Tools for PD Rating Model Development and Validation
# Version: 1.2.0
# Authors@R: person(given = "Andrija", family = "Djurovic", role = c("aut", "cre"), email = "djandrija@gmail.com")
# Maintainer: Andrija Djurovic <djandrija@gmail.com>
# Description: The goal of this package is to cover the most common steps in probability of default (PD) rating model development and validation. The main procedures available are those that refer to univariate, bivariate, multivariate analysis, calibration and validation. Along with accompanied 'monobin' and 'monobinShiny' packages, 'PDtoolkit' provides functions which are suitable for different data transformation and modeling tasks such as: imputations, monotonic binning of numeric risk factors, binning of categorical risk factors, weights of evidence (WoE) and information value (IV) calculations, WoE coding (replacement of risk factors modalities with WoE values), risk factor clustering, area under curve (AUC) calculation and others. Additionally, package provides set of validation functions for testing homogeneity, heterogeneity, discriminatory and predictive power of the model.
# License: GPL (>= 3)
# URL: https://github.com/andrija-djurovic/PDtoolkit
# Encoding: UTF-8
# LazyData: true
# RoxygenNote: 7.1.1
# Depends: monobin, R (>= 2.10)
# Imports: dplyr, rpart
# NeedsCompilation: no
# Packaged: 2023-09-20 05:00:49 UTC; adjurovic

# Repository: CRAN
